title: Delhi Metro
summary: The Delhi Metro is a mass rapid transit (MRT) system serving Delhi and its satellite cities of Ghaziabad, Faridabad, Gurgaon, Noida, Bahadurgarh and Ballabhgarh, in the National Capital Region of India.[8] It is by far the largest and busiest metro rail system in India, and the second oldest after the Kolkata Metro.[9] The network consists of 10 colour-coded lines[1] serving 254 stations[Nb 1] with a total length of 348.12 kilometres (216.31Â mi).[Nb 2] The system has a mix of underground, at-grade, and elevated stations using both broad-gauge and standard-gauge. Delhi Metro operates over 2,700 trips daily, starting at around 05:00 and ending at 23:30.[11]
